content:
That's a great idea! Since you already love the artist's style and have a specific design in mind, commissioning a custom piece that matches their aesthetic can be a wonderful way to get a unique and personalized item.

By asking the artist to create a custom piece in their signature style, you're leveraging their expertise and creative vision while still getting a one-of-a-kind piece that meets your specific needs. This approach can also help ensure that the new piece will complement the hand-painted plates you already have.

To increase the chances of getting a successful commission, make sure to:

1. **Provide clear design guidance**: Share your design ideas, inspirations, and any reference images you have. This will help the artist understand your vision and create a piece that meets your expectations.
2. **Discuss the design elements**: Talk to the artist about the specific design elements you want to incorporate, such as colors, patterns, shapes, or themes.
3. **Be open to feedback and suggestions**: Remember that the artist is the expert in their medium, so be open to their feedback and suggestions. They may have ideas or insights that can enhance your design concept.
4. **Establish a clear brief**: Make sure to get a written agreement or brief that outlines the design, materials, timeline, and price. This will help ensure you're both on the same page.

By working closely with the artist and providing clear guidance, you can increase the chances of getting a custom piece that you'll love and that will complement your existing hand-painted plates.

Go for it, and I hope you'll end up with a stunning custom piece that brings you joy!
